content.question:
All coordinates are approximate.

Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at point (0 comma 2.5).

The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at the labeled point A (3 comma 4.4).

At point (3 comma 4.4), the curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at the labeled point B (9 comma 0.6).

At point (9 comma 0.6), the curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at the labeled point C (15 comma 4).

At point (15 comma 4), the curve trends down gradually to reach a minimum point at the labeled point D (21 comma 1).

At point (21 comma 1), the curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at the labeled point E (28 comma 4.4).

The curve follows the same pattern, further reaching four maximum points and four minimum points.

The curve ends at point (80 comma 0.8).

​A graph of the depth of water at a pier in the ocean is given, along with five labeled points <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="C"><semantics><mi>C</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="D"><semantics><mi>D</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. For the time periods near these data points, a periodic relationship between depth of water, in feet, and time, in hours, can be modeled using one cycle of the periodic relationship. Based on the graph, which of the following is true?

choices.label: ​The time interval between points <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the period.

​​The time interval between points <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="C"><semantics><mi>C</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the period.

​​The time interval between points <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="D"><semantics><mi>D</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the period.

​​The time interval between points <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the period.

content.answer: ​​The time interval between points <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the period.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
